alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 3:43PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Oklahoma, northwestern Cleveland and northwestern McClain Counties through 430 PM CST... At 343 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Oklahoma City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, northwestern Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Spencer, Valley Brook, Tinker Air Force Base, Stanley Draper Lake, Forest Park, Lake Aluma, Smith Village, The Capitol and Will Rogers Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 113 and 132. Interstate 40 between mile markers 147 and 161. Interstate 44 between mile markers 102 and 120. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to rapid reductions in visibility.
